newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed on Wednesday in moderate trade on interbank and retail interest, dealers said.

"The interbank rate recovered slightly today, but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were narrowly mixed but bond prices were slightly higher. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 1.70/1.65 percent compared with Tuesday's yield of 1.68/1.63 percent and one-year at a yield of 1.60/1.55 percent against 1.63/1.58 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$99.31/99.36 from Tuesday's close of S$99.23/99.28, September 2001 at S$99.41/99.46 versus S$99.33/99.38 and June 2003 at S$99.08/99.13 against S$99.00/99.05.
The overnight interbank offered rate rose to 2-3/4 2-5/8 percent from Tuesday's 2-1/2 2-3/8 percent.
